Package gov.sandia.geotess

Class GeoTessExplorer

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.geotess.GeoTessExplorer
public class GeoTessExplorer
extends java.lang.Object
A command line driven set of utilities that can be used to extract maps, vertical slices, boreholes and vtk plot files from aÆ’GeoTessModel. Available functions include:
  • version -- output the GeoTess version number
  • toString -- print summary information about a model
  • updateModelDescription -- update the description information for a model
  • statistics -- print summary statistics about the data in a model
  • extractGrid -- load a model or grid and write its grid to stdout, vtk, kml, ascii or binary file
  • resample -- resample a model onto a new grid
  • extractActiveNodes -- load a model and extract the positions of all active nodes
  • replaceAttributeValues -- replace the attribute values associated with all active nodes
  • reformat -- load a model and write it out in another format
  • getValues -- interpolate values at a single point
  • getValuesFile -- interpolate values at points specified in an ascii file
  • interpolatePoint -- interpolate values at a single point, verbose output
  • borehole -- interpolate values along a radial profile
  • profile -- extract model values at vertex closest to specified latitude, longitude position
  • findClosestPoint -- find the closest point to a supplied geographic location and return information about it
  • slice -- interpolate values on a vertical plane defined by a great circle
  • sliceDistAz -- interpolate values on a vertical plane defined by a great circle defined by a point, a distance and a direction
  • mapValuesDepth -- interpolate values on a lat, lon grid at constant depths
  • mapValuesLayer -- interpolate values on a lat, lon grid at fractional radius in a layer
  • mapLayerBoundary -- depth of layer boundaries on a lat, lon grid
  • mapLayerThickness -- layer thickness on a lat, lon grid
  • values3DBlock -- interpolate values on a regular lat, lon, radius grid
  • function -- new model with attributes calculated from two input models
  • vtkLayers -- generate vtk plot file of values at the tops of layers
  • vtkDepths -- generate vtk plot file of values at specified depths
  • vtkLayerThickness -- generate vtk plot file of layer thicknesses
  • vtkLayerBoundary -- generate vtk plot file of depth or elevation of layer boundaries
  • vtkSlice -- generate vtk plot file of vertical slice
  • vtkSolid -- generate vtk plot file of entire globe
  • vtk3DBlock -- generate vtk plot file of values on a lat-lon-depth grid
  • vtkPoints -- generate vtk plot of point data
  • vtkRobinson -- generate vtk plot of a Robinson projection of model data
  • vtkRobinsonLayers -- generate vtk plot of a Robinson projection of model data at tops of multiple layers
  • vtkRobinsonPoints -- generate vtk plot of a Robinson projection of point data
  • vtkRobinsonTriangleSize -- generate vtk plot of triangle size on Robinson projection
  • vtkLayerAverage -- generate vtk plot of the average values within the crust of a designated model
  • reciprocalModel -- generates a reciprocal GeoTessModel, where all values are inverted
  • renameLayer -- renames an individual layer in a GeoTessModel
  • renameLayers -- renames all layers in a GeoTessModel
  • getLatitudes -- array of equally spaced latitude values
  • getLongitudes -- array of equally spaced longitude values
  • getDistanceDegrees -- array of equally spaced distances along a great circle
  • translatePolygon -- translate polygon between kml/kmz and ascii format
  • extractSiteTerms -- extract site terms from a GeoTessModelSiteData and print to screen
  • replaceSiteTerms -- replace site terms in a GeoTessModelSiteData with values loaded from a file
  • getClassName -- discover the class name of a specified model
  • extractPathDependentUncertaintyRSTT -- extract all the path dependent uncertainty information from a GeoTessModelSLBM
  • replacePathDependentUncertaintyRSTT -- replace all the path dependent uncertainty information in a GeoTessModelSLBM

For all options except the vtk option, output is sent to standard out. The intention is that users would either pipe the output to a file or insert the call to this program into a script with the output piped to some other program.

If no arguments are supplied, a list of the recognized functions is output. If the first argument is a recognized function but other required arguments are missing, a list of the required arguments is output.

Many functions require a 'list of attributes'. This list can be a string similar to '0,2,4-n', which would return attributes 0, 2 and 4 through the number of available attributes. 'n' would return only the last attribute. 'all' and '0-n' would both return all attributes. 'none' would return no values at all. The list may not include any spaces.

For most functions, the first two arguments after the function name are the name of the input model file and the relative path to the grid directory. Some models have the grid stored in the same file with the model while other models reference a grid stored in a separate file. If the grid is stored in the same file with the model, then the relative path to the grid directory is irrelevant but something must be supplied in order to maintain the order of the argument list. If the grid is stored in a separate file then the name of the file that contains the grid, without any directory information, is stored in the model file. When the model is loaded, it has to be told the relative path from the directory where the model is located to the directory where the grid file is located. If the grid is in a separate file located in the same directory as the model file, provide the single character '.'. Note that models and grids also contain an MD5 hash of the grid file contents so the danger of a model referencing the wrong grid is vanishingly small.

All the functions whose names start with 'vtk' extract information from a GeoTessModel and store it in a file in VTK format (http://www.vtk.org/VTK/img/file-formats.pdf). These files can be visualized with free software called ParaView. Visit http://www.paraview.org for more information and downloads for various platforms.

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      A command line driven set of utilities that can be used to extract maps, vertical slices, boreholes and vtk plot files from a GeoTessModel. Available functions include:
      • version -- output the GeoTess version number
      • toString -- print summary information about a model
      • updateModelDescription -- update the description information for a model
      • statistics -- print summary statistics about the data in a model
      • extractGrid -- load a model or grid and write its grid to stdout, vtk, kml, ascii or binary file
      • resample -- resample a model onto a new grid
      • extractActiveNodes -- load a model and extract the positions of all active nodes
      • replaceAttributeValues -- replace the attribute values associated with all active nodes
      • reformat -- load a model and write it out in another format
      • getValues -- interpolate values at a single point
      • getValuesFile -- interpolate values at points specified in an ascii file
      • interpolatePoint -- interpolate values at a single point, verbose output
      • borehole -- interpolate values along a radial profile
      • profile -- extract model values at vertex closest to specified latitude, longitude position
      • findClosestPoint -- find the closest point to a supplied geographic location and return information about it
      • slice -- interpolate values on a vertical plane defined by a great circle
      • sliceDistAz -- interpolate values on a vertical plane defined by a great circle defined by a point, a distance and a direction
      • mapValuesDepth -- interpolate values on a lat, lon grid at constant depths
      • mapValuesLayer -- interpolate values on a lat, lon grid at fractional radius in a layer
      • mapLayerBoundary -- depth of layer boundaries on a lat, lon grid
      • mapLayerThickness -- layer thickness on a lat, lon grid
      • values3DBlock -- interpolate values on a regular lat, lon, radius grid
      • function -- new model with attributes calculated from two input models
      • vtkLayers -- generate vtk plot file of values at the tops of layers
      • vtkDepths -- generate vtk plot file of values at specified depths
      • vtkLayerThickness -- generate vtk plot file of layer thicknesses
      • vtkLayerBoundary -- generate vtk plot file of depth or elevation of layer boundaries
      • vtkSlice -- generate vtk plot file of vertical slice
      • vtkSolid -- generate vtk plot file of entire globe
      • vtk3DBlock -- generate vtk plot file of values on a lat-lon-depth grid
      • vtkPoints -- generate vtk plot of point data
      • vtkRobinson -- generate vtk plot of a Robinson projection of model data
      • vtkRobinsonLayers -- generate vtk plot of a Robinson projection of model data at tops of multiple layers
      • vtkRobinsonPoints -- generate vtk plot of a Robinson projection of point data
      • vtkRobinsonTriangleSize -- generate vtk plot of triangle size on Robinson projection
      • vtkLayerAverage -- generate vtk plot of the average values within the crust of a designated model
      • reciprocalModel -- generates a reciprocal GeoTessModel, where all values are inverted
      • renameLayer -- renames an individual layer in a GeoTessModel
      • renameLayers -- renames all layers in a GeoTessModel
      • getLatitudes -- array of equally spaced latitude values
      • getLongitudes -- array of equally spaced longitude values
      • getDistanceDegrees -- array of equally spaced distances along a great circle
      • translatePolygon -- translate polygon between kml/kmz and ascii format
      • extractSiteTerms -- extract site terms from a GeoTessModelSiteData and print to screen
      • replaceSiteTerms -- replace site terms in a GeoTessModelSiteData with values loaded from a file
      • getClassName -- discover the class name of a specified model
      • extractPathDependentUncertaintyRSTT -- extract all the path dependent uncertainty information from a GeoTessModelSLBM
      • replacePathDependentUncertaintyRSTT -- replace all the path dependent uncertainty information in a GeoTessModelSLBM

      For all options except the vtk option, output is sent to standard out. The intention is that users would either pipe the output to a file or insert the call to this program into a script with the output piped to some other program.

      If no arguments are supplied, a list of the recognized functions is output. If the first argument is a recognized function but other required arguments are missing, a list of the required arguments is output.

      Many functions require a 'list of attributes'. This list can be a string similar to '0,2,4-n', which would return attributes 0, 2 and 4 through the number of available attributes. 'n' would return only the last attribute. 'all' and '0-n' would both return all attributes. 'none' would return no values at all. The list may not include any spaces.

      For most functions, the first two arguments after the function name are the name of the input model file and the relative path to the grid directory. Some models have the grid stored in the same file with the model while other models reference a grid stored in a separate file. If the grid is stored in the same file with the model, then the relative path to the grid directory is irrelevant but something must be supplied in order to maintain the order of the argument list. If the grid is stored in a separate file then the name of the file that contains the grid, without any directory information, is stored in the model file. When the model is loaded, it has to be told the relative path from the directory where the model is located to the directory where the grid file is located. If the grid is in a separate file located in the same directory as the model file, provide the single character '.'. Note that models and grids also contain an MD5 hash of the grid file contents so the danger of a model referencing the wrong grid is vanishingly small.

      All the functions whose names start with 'vtk' extract information from a GeoTessModel and store it in a file in VTK format (http://www.vtk.org/VTK/img/file-formats.pdf). These files can be visualized with free software called ParaView. Visit http://www.paraview.org for more information and downloads for various platforms.

      Parameters:
      args - the first argument should be one of the functions defined above. Subsequent arguments depend on the first argument.

    • translatePolygon

      public void translatePolygon​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Translate a Polygon from Google Earth kml/kmz format to ascii format readable by GeoTess C++ libraries.
      Parameters:
      args -
      1. translatePolygon
      2. input polygon file name
      3. output polygon file name. If the file extension is 'vtk' then the file is written in vtk format. If the file extension is 'kml' or 'kmz' the file is written in a format compatible with Google Earth. Otherwise the file is written in ascii format with boundary points writtein in lat-lon order.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • extractSiteTerms

      public void extractSiteTerms​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.io.IOException
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • gridToKML

      public void gridToKML​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Deprecated.
      use extractGrid instead.
      Output a GeoTessGrid tessellation to a kml/kmz file for viewing with Google Earth.
      Parameters:
      args -
      1. gridToKML
      2. input model or grid file name
      3. relative path to grid directory, otherwise ignored
      4. output file (must have kml or kmz extension)
      5. layerIndex if 2 is a model, tessId if 2 is a grid
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

      public void resample​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception

      Parameters:

    • extractActiveNodes

      public void extractActiveNodes​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Extract the position of all active nodes in a model, in 'lat lon depth layerIndex' format.

      Output is streamed to standard out.

      Parameters:
      args -
      1. extractActiveNodes
      2. input model file name
      3. relative path to grid directory (not used if grid stored in model file)
      4. list of attribute indexes
      5. reciprocal (true or false)
      6. path of polygon file (if 'null' then all grid nodes will be included)
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • replaceAttributeValues

      public void replaceAttributeValues​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Populate model.
      Parameters:
      args -
      1. replaceAttributeValues
      2. input model file name
      3. relative path to grid directory (not used if grid stored in model file)
      4. polygon file (if 'null' then all grid nodes will be included)
      5. file of attribute values
      6. output model file name
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • reformat

      public void reformat​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Translate a model file from one format to another, or change the grid path information in a file.

      If the supplied input model file name is a directory then the operation is performed on every GeoTessModel file in the directory.

      If an attempt is made to make a GeoTessModel reference a Grid in another file, and the internal gridIDs in the model file and grid file do not agree, the attempt will fail.

      To convert libcorr3d model(s) from common-rotated grid configuration to custom grid configuration, specify outputGridFile = internal and run_time_euler_rotations = false.

      To convert libcorr3d model(s) from custom grid configuration to common-rotated grid configuration, specify outputGridFile = [a valid grid file name] and run_time_euler_rotations = true. Note that outputGridFile will be created if it does not exist. If outputGridFile contains substring <gridId>, the substring will be replaced with the gridId of the grid.

      Parameters:
      args -
      1. reformat
      2. input model file name or directory. If directory, reformat is applied to every GeoTessModel in the directory
      3. relative path to grid directory (not used if grid stored in model file)
      4. output model file name or directory
      5. outputGridFile:
        • path to file to which to write the grid (string <gridId> is replaced with gridId).
        • if 'internal', write the grid internally to the output model file.
        • if omitted or 'null', then treat the grid file the same way the input model did.
      6. runtime_euler_rotations (true or false)
      7. geotess output file format (integer; if omitted or < 0 default value is used)
      8. libcorr3d output file format (integer; applies only to libcorr3d models; if omitted or < 0 default value is used)
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • findClosestPoint

      public void findClosestPoint​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Find the closest point to a supplied geographic location and return information about the point such as, lat, lon, depth, vertex index, etc.
      Parameters:
      args -
      1. findClosestPoint
      2. input model file name
      3. relative path to grid directory (not used if grid stored in model file)
      4. latitude, degrees
      5. longitude, degrees
      6. depth, km
      7. layer ID. Ignored if -1
      8. ouput: some subset of [lat,lon,depth,radius,vertex,layer,node,point], comma separated, no spaces
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • interpolatePoint

      public void interpolatePoint​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Output to standard out interpolated values and coefficients for a single point.
      Parameters:
      args -
      1. interpolatePoint
      2. input model file name
      3. relative path to grid directory (not used if grid stored in model file)
      4. latitude, degrees
      5. longitude, degrees
      6. depth, km
      7. layer ID. If -1, then interpolation is not contrained to a layer
      8. interpolation type horizontal: linear or natural_neighbor (nn)
      9. interpolation type radial: linear or cubic_spline (cs)
      10. reciprocal (true or false)
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • getValues

      public void getValues​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Output to standard out interpolated values at a single point.
      Parameters:
      args -
      1. getValues
      2. input model file name
      3. relative path to grid directory (not used if grid stored in model file)
      4. latitude, degrees
      5. longitude, degrees
      6. depth, km
      7. layer ID. Ignored if -1
      8. list of attribute indexes
      9. interpolation type horizontal: linear or natural_neighbor (nn)
      10. interpolation type radial: linear or cubic_spline (cs)
      11. reciprocal (true or false)
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • getValuesFile

      public void getValuesFile​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Output to standard out interpolated values at a single point.
      Parameters:
      args -
      1. getValue
      2. input model file name
      3. relative path to grid directory (not used if grid stored in model file)
      4. name of file with input lat, lon, depth values
      5. layer ID. Ignored if -1
      6. list of attribute indexes
      7. interpolation type horizontal: linear or natural_neighbor (nn)
      8. interpolation type radial: linear or cubic_spline (cs)
      9. reciprocal (true or false)
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • borehole

      public void borehole​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Output to standard out a 2D array of values representing attribute values on a radial profile through the model. The array has dimensions nRadialValues x nAttributes with the attributes index changing fastest.
      Parameters:
      args -
      1. borehole
      2. input model file name
      3. relative path to grid directory (not used if grid stored in model file)
      4. latitude, degrees
      5. longitude, degrees
      6. maximum radial spacing, km
      7. index of first layer (deepest)
      8. index of last layer (shallowest)
      9. interpolation type, either 'linear', or 'natutal_neighbor'
      10. [ depth | radius ]
      11. reciprocal [true | false]. If true, reported values are 1./(model value). Useful when model stores slowness, but velocity is desired.
      12. list of attribute indexes
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • profile

      public void profile​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Output to standard out a 2D array of values representing attribute values on a radial profile through the model. The array has dimensions nRadialValues x nAttributes with the attributes index changing fastest. Data and radius values obtained from the vertex that is closest to the specified lat, lon position.
      Parameters:
      args -
      1. profile
      2. input model file name
      3. relative path to grid directory (not used if grid stored in model file)
      4. latitude, degrees
      5. longitude, degrees
      6. index of first layer (deepest)
      7. index of last layer (shallowest)
      8. [ depth | radius ]
      9. reciprocal [true | false]. If true, reported values are 1./(model value). Useful when model stores slowness, but velocity is desired.
      10. list of attribute indexes
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • mapValuesDepth

      public void mapValuesDepth​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Output to standard out a 3D array of values representing attribute values at a contant depth on a regular lat, lon grid of points. The array has dimensions nLat x nLon x nAttributes with the attributes index changing fastest.
      Parameters:
      args -
      1. mapValuesDepth
      2. input model file name
      3. relative path to grid directory (not used if grid stored in model file)
      4. first latitude, degrees
      5. last latitude, degrees
      6. either dlat (include '.') or nlat (no '.')
      7. first longitude, degrees
      8. last longitude, degrees
      9. either dlon (include '.') or nlon (no '.')
      10. layerID. If >=0 interpolated values constrained to layer radii.
      11. depth, km
      12. interpolation type, either 'linear', or 'natutal_neighbor'
      13. reciprocal [true | false]. If true, reported values are 1./(model value). Useful when model stores slowness, but velocity is desired.
      14. list of attribute indexes
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • mapValuesLayer

      public void mapValuesLayer​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Output to standard out a 3D array of values representing attribute values at a constant fractional radius in a layer, on a regular lat, lon grid of points. The array has dimensions nLat x nLon x nAttributes with the attributes index changing fastest.
      Parameters:
      args -
      1. mapValuesLayer
      2. input model file name
      3. relative path to grid directory (not used if grid stored in model file)
      4. first latitude, degrees
      5. last latitude, degrees
      6. either dlat (include '.') or nlat (no '.')
      7. first longitude, degrees
      8. last longitude, degrees
      9. either dlon (include '.') or nlon (no '.')
      10. layer number
      11. fractional radius within the layer (0=bottom, 0.5=middle, 1=top)
      12. interpolation type, either 'linear', or 'natutal_neighbor'
      13. reciprocal [true | false]. If true, reported values are 1./(model value). Useful when model stores slowness, but velocity is desired.
      14. list of attribute indexes
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • values3DBlock

      public void values3DBlock​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Output to standard out a 4D array of values representing attribute values on a regular lat, lon, radius grid of points. The array has dimensions nLon x nLat x nRadii x nAttributes with the attributes index changing fastest.
      Parameters:
      args -
      1. values3DBlock
      2. input model file name
      3. relative path to grid directory (not used if grid stored in model file)
      4. first latitude, degrees
      5. last latitude, degrees
      6. either dlat (include '.') or nlat (no '.')
      7. first longitude, degrees
      8. last longitude, degrees
      9. either dlon (include '.') or nlon (no '.')
      10. index of first layer
      11. index of last layer
      12. radialDimension: depth or radius.
      13. max radial spacing of points, in km.
      14. interpolation type horizontal: linear or natural_neighbor (nn)
      15. interpolation type radial: linear or cubic_spline (cs)
      16. reciprocal [true | false]. If true, reported values are 1./(model value). Useful when model stores slowness, but velocity is desired.
      17. list of attribute indexes
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • mapLayerBoundary

      public void mapLayerBoundary​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Output to standard out a 2D array of values representing the depth or radius (in km) of the top or bottom of a specified layer on a regular lat, lon grid. The output array has dimensions nLat x nLon with longitude index changing fastest.
      Parameters:
      args -
      1. mapLayerBoundary
      2. input model file name
      3. relative path to grid directory (not used if grid stored in model file)
      4. first latitude, degrees
      5. last latitude, degrees
      6. either dlat (include '.') or nlat (no '.')
      7. first longitude, degrees
      8. last longitude, degrees
      9. either dlon (include '.') or nlon (no '.')
      10. layer number
      11. [ top | bottom ] of layer
      12. [ depth | radius ]
      13. interpolation type, either 'linear', or 'natutal_neighbor'
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • mapLayerThickness

      public void mapLayerThickness​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Output to standard out a 2D array of values representing the thickness (in km) of the specified layers on a regular lat, lon grid. The output array has dimensions nLat x nLon with nLon index changing fastest. Thickness values are the sum of the thicknesses from bottom of first layer to top of last layer.
      Parameters:
      args -
      1. mapLayerThickness
      2. input model file name
      3. relative path to grid directory (not used if grid stored in model file)
      4. first latitude, degrees
      5. last latitude, degrees
      6. either dlat (include '.') or nlat (no '.')
      7. first longitude, degrees
      8. last longitude, degrees
      9. either dlon (include '.') or nlon (no '.')
      10. index of first layer
      11. index of last layer. . Thickness will include first through last layer, inclusive
      12. interpolation type, either 'linear', or 'natutal_neighbor'
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • slice

      public void slice​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Output to standard out a 3D array of values representing attribute values on a vertical slice through the model. The array has dimensions nDistanceValues x nRadialValues x nAttributes with the attributes index changing fastest.
      Parameters:
      args -
      1. slice
      2. input model file name
      3. relative path to grid directory (not used if grid stored in model file)
      4. latitude of first point, degrees
      5. longitude of first point, degrees
      6. latitude of last point, degrees
      7. longitude of last point, degrees
      8. shortest path (true or false). If false, go the long way around the earth (path length > 180 degrees).
      9. nPoints
      10. maximum radial spacing, km
      11. index of first layer (deepest)
      12. index of last layer (shallowest)
      13. interpolation type, either 'linear', or 'natutal_neighbor'
      14. spatialCoordinates. Subset of distance,depth,radius,x,y,z,lat,lon
      15. reciprocal [true | false]. If true, reported values are 1./(model value). Useful when model stores slowness, but velocity is desired.
      16. list of attribute indexes
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

      7. azimuth to last point, degrees
      8. nPoints
      9. maximum radial spacing, km
      10. index of first layer (deepest)
      11. index of last layer (shallowest)
      12. interpolation type, either 'linear', or 'natutal_neighbor'
      13. spatialCoordinates. Subset of distance,depth,radius,x,y,z,lat,lon
      14. reciprocal [true | false]. If true, reported values are 1./(model value). Useful when model stores slowness, but velocity is desired.
      15. list of attribute indexes
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • function

      public void function​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Construct a new GeoTessModel that has Data values that are a function of the Data values in the two supplied GeoTessModels.

      Supported functions:

      1. v1 - v0; // simple difference
      2. 1/v1 - 1/v0; // difference of reciprocals
      3. 100 * (v1 - v0) / v0; // % change
      4. 100.*(1/v1 - 1/v0) / (1/v0); // % change of reciprocals
      If function is anything else, new model will be populated with NaN.
      Parameters:
      args -
      1. function
      2. input model0 file name
      3. relative path to grid0 directory (not used if grid stored in model file)
      4. attribute index 0
      5. input model1 file name
      6. relative path to grid1 directory (not used if grid stored in model file)
      7. attribute index 1
      8. geometry model file name
      9. relative path to geometry grid directory (not used if grid stored in model file)
      10. output file name
      11. reference to grid file ( if '.', then grid and data written together to same file )
      12. function index:
        1. v1 - v0; // simple difference
        2. 1/v1 - 1/v0; // difference of reciprocals
        3. 100 * (v1 - v0) / v0; // % change
        4. 100.*(1/v1 - 1/v0) / (1/v0); // % change of reciprocals
      13. new attribute name
      14. new attribute units
      15. InterpolatorType linear or natural_neighbor (nn)
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • vtkSolid

      public void vtkSolid​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Output to vtk file attribute values on a solid 3D globe.

      5. max radial spacing in km (50 km usually adequate)
      6. reciprocal [true | false]. If true, reported values are 1./(model value). Useful when model stores slowness, but velocity is desired.
      7. list of attribute indexes
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • vtkRobinson

      public void vtkRobinson​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Generate a contour map of some data values on a Robinson projection of the Earth.

      Also generates another file that contains the outlines of the continents plotted on the same map projection. The file is located in the same directory as the outputFile, with the name 'map_coastlines_centerLon_%d.vtk' where %d is replaced with the longitude of the center of the map rounded to the nearest degree.

      Parameters:
      args -
      1. vtkRobinson
      2. input model file name
      3. relative path to grid directory (not used if grid stored in model file)
      4. output file name
      5. longitude of center of map in degrees
      6. depth in the Earth where the data is to be interpolated.
      7. layer the index of the layer in which depth resides.
      8. radiusOutOfRangeAllowed if true and depth is above the top of layer or below bottom of layer then the values at the top or bottom of layer are plotted. If false and depth is above the top of layer or below bottom of layer then NaN is plotted.
      9. interpolation type (radial): linear or cubic_spline (cs)
      10. reciprocal [true | false], report 1./value
      11. list of attribute indexes
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • vtkRobinsonLayers

      public void vtkRobinsonLayers​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Generate contour maps of some data values on a Robinson projection of the Earth. A separate map is generated for each of a specified list of layer indexes. Values at the tops of the layers are generated.

      Also generates another file that contains the outlines of the continents plotted on the same map projection. The file is located in the same directory as the outputFile, with the name 'map_coastlines_centerLon_%d.vtk' where %d is replaced with the longitude of the center of the map rounded to the nearest degree.

      Parameters:
      args -
      1. vtkRobinsonLayers
      2. input model file name
      3. relative path to grid directory (not used if grid stored in model file)
      4. output file, '%d' replaced with layer index
      5. longitude of center of map in degrees
      6. list of layer indexes
      7. reciprocal [true | false], report 1./value
      8. list of attribute indexes
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • vtkRobinsonTriangleSize

      public void vtkRobinsonTriangleSize​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Generate a contour map of some data values on a Robinson projection of the Earth.

      Also generates another file that contains the outlines of the continents plotted on the same map projection. The file is located in the same directory as the outputFile, with the name 'map_coastlines_centerLon_%d.vtk' where %d is replaced with the longitude of the center of the map rounded to the nearest degree.

      Parameters:
      args -
      1. vtkRobinsonTriangleSize
      2. input model or grid file name
      3. relative path to grid directory, otherwise ignored
      4. output file
      5. layerIndex if 1 is a model, tessId if 1 is a grid
      6. longitude of center of map in degrees
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • parseList

      public int[] parseList​(java.lang.String stringList, int maxValue) throws java.lang.Exception
      Parse a list like "0,2,4-7" into an int[]. The substring 'n' is interpreted to be the value of specified 'maxValue'. If the list is equal to 'all', then values from 0 to maxValue are returned. If list is equal to none, empty array is returned.
      Parameters:
      stringList -
      maxValue -
      Returns:
      parsed list.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • getLatitudes

      public void getLatitudes​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Output to standard out an array of equally spaced latitude values. User specifies first latitude, last latitude and either step size or number of values. If the last parameter does not contain a '.' then it is interpreted as an integer number of values. If it contains a '.' then it is interpreted as the step size (a floating point value). If the step size is specified then the actual step size of generated latitude values may be somewhat smaller than the requested value so that an integral number of equally spaced values will be returned.
      Parameters:
      args -
      1. getLatitudes
      2. first latitude, arbitrary units
      3. last latitude, arbitrary units
      4. either the number of latitude values (if can be parsed as an integer), or the spacing of latitude values (if can be parsed as a double).
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • getLongitudes

      public void getLongitudes​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Output to standard out an array of equally spaced longitude values. User specifies first longitude, last longitude and either step size or number of values. If the last parameter does not contain a '.' then it is interpreted as an integer number of values. If it contains a '.' then it is interpreted as the step size (a floating point value). If the step size is specified then the actual step size of generated longitude values may be somewhat smaller than the requested value so that an integral number of equally spaced values will be returned.

      If the first longitude is greater than the last longitude, (170 and -170, for example), then 360 is added to the last longitude.

      Parameters:
      args -
      1. getLongitudes
      2. first longitude, degrees
      3. last longitude, degrees
      4. either the number of longitude values (if can be parsed as an integer), or the spacing of longitude values in degrees (if can be parsed as a double).
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • getDistanceDegrees

      public void getDistanceDegrees​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Output to standard out an array of equally spaced distance values, in degrees. User specifies the lat, lon positions of two points, and the number number of points, which are assumed to be equally spaced between the first and last point, inclusive. This routine otuputs the distance between the first point and each subsequent point. First value will be zero.
      Parameters:
      args -
      1. getDistanceDegrees
      2. lat1, degrees
      3. lon1, degrees
      4. lat2, degrees
      5. lon2, degrees
      6. nPoints
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception
